flow.descriptionCdata:
b44a6bba-a3e0-431b-825f-d52aa0ed88a8.005646ea-6c85-43bd-b922-9265cfb0656d.prompt=User Identifier b44a6bba-a3e0-431b-825f-d52aa0ed88a8.0b8439f7-8bfe-414f-9be3-3b91f9fc4099.prompt=Process Instance ID b44a6bba-a3e0-431b-825f-d52aa0ed88a8.108577e2-c8e8-4a36-8bdf-1000a858c455.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State b44a6bba-a3e0-431b-825f-d52aa0ed88a8.219e433c-8ee0-4912-837e-c0c9b19daba0.prompt=Process Instance ID b44a6bba-a3e0-431b-825f-d52aa0ed88a8.2f92d40f-077d-4fd4-8d4d-00cba0ef2eaa.prompt=User Identifier b44a6bba-a3e0-431b-825f-d52aa0ed88a8.374dca98-5021-45d3-9928-c1a0cd22b2a5.prompt=Password\: b44a6bba-a3e0-431b-825f-d52aa0ed88a8.381fb14c-dc77-4509-b606-c6ac504ead69.description=Changes a VM's power state. Must specify either hostSystem, clusterName, or vmResourcePool as a target location for VMs. Input Parameters\: vmName - name of the VM that will be created with this flow templateName - name of the VM template to clone in vCenter osType - linux or windows host - vCenter host to execute against user - vCenter username password - vCenter password vmDatacenter - target Datacenter on the vCenter host for the VMs dataStore - target datastore on the vCenter host for the VMs hostSystem - target ESX host for the VMs clusterName - target cluster for the VMs vmResourcePool - target resource pool for the VMs vmPowerState - the desired power state (on / off etc) Responses\: success - if the command completes execution and its exit code is 0 failure - otherwise Result Fields\: serviceXml - xml representation of the server created in vCenter b44a6bba-a3e0-431b-825f-d52aa0ed88a8.418856b2-3729-407a-8011-22baf5bab079.prompt=VMWare Host\: b44a6bba-a3e0-431b-825f-d52aa0ed88a8.47662b7c-7eac-4e64-a15f-937c16f4417a.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
b44a6bba-a3e0-431b-825f-d52aa0ed88a8.5753a61e-23cb-416e-bc83-c45d075652b9.prompt=VMWare User\: b44a6bba-a3e0-431b-825f-d52aa0ed88a8.577c92f5-f49c-4336-92ae-2a3ba00b4be5.prompt=Component ID b44a6bba-a3e0-431b-825f-d52aa0ed88a8.5ead09d4-732c-47ab-9776-4664d3b9f990.description=This workflow adds/updates the component property using Artifact APIs. onlyUpdate\: yes/no yes - To update values of existing property (In this case input "valueType" is not required , This input will not be considered even if provided) no - To add/update property valueType - Value type of the property. It can have value from selection list "CSA-Property-ValueType". This Input is required only when Input "onlyUpdate" is selected as "no". values - One or more values dilimited by comma , (If user want to use some other separator for multiple values then needs to be pass as next input "separator") separator - A delimiter that separates elements in the values ( default dilimiter used is comma ,) b44a6bba-a3e0-431b-825f-d52aa0ed88a8.6928961c-e033-4f8a-b0a8-840b48e6a530.prompt=Process Instance ID b44a6bba-a3e0-431b-825f-d52aa0ed88a8.6f83d72e-2b1a-4ba0-90dd-9f926942b844.prompt=User Identifier b44a6bba-a3e0-431b-825f-d52aa0ed88a8.746a4140-2764-4272-b3af-3809699c27f6.prompt=User Identifier b44a6bba-a3e0-431b-825f-d52aa0ed88a8.908f3933-ab83-4150-8f4c-199411907ec6.description=
Compares two strings, returning a true response if and only if they contain the same sequence of characters. A null string is considered to be equal to an empty string.

Inputs\:
string1 - The first string.
string2 - The second string.
ignoreCase - If set to 'true', then the comparison ignores case considerations. The two strings are considered equal ignoring case if they are of the same length and corresponding characters in the two strings are equal ignoring case. If set to any value other than 'true', then the strings must match exactly to be considered equal.

responses\:
true - If the two strings are equal
false - If the two strings are not equal
b44a6bba-a3e0-431b-825f-d52aa0ed88a8.989b8e1f-d627-487a-bb2c-8d016c4bdfc2.prompt=User Identifier b44a6bba-a3e0-431b-825f-d52aa0ed88a8.98fe4691-8797-4c74-823e-e2cd00517bb4.prompt=Artifact ID b44a6bba-a3e0-431b-825f-d52aa0ed88a8.9fe490e8-7f0a-4407-96eb-5b7ed45dac99.prompt=Process Instance ID b44a6bba-a3e0-431b-825f-d52aa0ed88a8.a796854f-76f5-47cd-8de8-cd1c5547e6bd.prompt=Resource Provider ID b44a6bba-a3e0-431b-825f-d52aa0ed88a8.a86872c9-0731-4725-a594-014d4d6de7aa.description=
Retrieve power state of virtual machine (poweredOn,poweredOff,suspended).

Inputs\:
host - VMWare host hostname or IP.
user - VMWare username.
password - VMWare user's password.
port - Port to connect on.
protocol - Connection protocol (http or https).
closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation (true, false).
virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. Inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/Folder/MyVM), Name of VM, IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123).
vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type (inventorypath, name, ip, hostname, uuid, vmid).

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.

Returns\:
returnResult - Task completion return message.
powerState - Power state (poweredOn,poweredOff,suspended).

Notes\:
Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
b44a6bba-a3e0-431b-825f-d52aa0ed88a8.be03f5c5-d9d2-46ac-806c-b89f7bf6d9ce.prompt=User Identifier b44a6bba-a3e0-431b-825f-d52aa0ed88a8.c8286806-9b7e-41bd-ab52-e029ba9c5306.description=Changes a VM's power state. Must specify either hostSystem, clusterName, or vmResourcePool as a target location for VMs. Input Parameters\: vmName - name of the VM that will be created with this flow templateName - name of the VM template to clone in vCenter osType - linux or windows host - vCenter host to execute against user - vCenter username password - vCenter password vmDatacenter - target Datacenter on the vCenter host for the VMs dataStore - target datastore on the vCenter host for the VMs hostSystem - target ESX host for the VMs clusterName - target cluster for the VMs vmResourcePool - target resource pool for the VMs vmPowerState - the desired power state (on / off etc) Responses\: success - if the command completes execution and its exit code is 0 failure - otherwise Result Fields\: serviceXml - xml representation of the server created in vCenter b44a6bba-a3e0-431b-825f-d52aa0ed88a8.c8474b70-d637-4bef-8494-b6374257c6c9.description=This workflow returns the component properties and values using Artifact APIs. result\: propertyNameValuesList\: pipe separated list of property name and values ( where each property name and values would be ; seprated and multiple values would be , seprated) e.g. - property 1; value1,value2|property 2; value3|property 3; value3,value4|........ b44a6bba-a3e0-431b-825f-d52aa0ed88a8.c8fd4649-cd7f-4a3a-829a-9b6afef99a42.description=Changes a VM's power state. Must specify either hostSystem, clusterName, or vmResourcePool as a target location for VMs. Input Parameters\: vmName - name of the VM that will be created with this flow templateName - name of the VM template to clone in vCenter osType - linux or windows host - vCenter host to execute against user - vCenter username password - vCenter password vmDatacenter - target Datacenter on the vCenter host for the VMs dataStore - target datastore on the vCenter host for the VMs hostSystem - target ESX host for the VMs clusterName - target cluster for the VMs vmResourcePool - target resource pool for the VMs vmPowerState - the desired power state (on / off etc) Responses\: success - if the command completes execution and its exit code is 0 failure - otherwise Result Fields\: serviceXml - xml representation of the server created in vCenter b44a6bba-a3e0-431b-825f-d52aa0ed88a8.cb720c75-33e1-4179-986b-3eda39bed501.prompt=Virtual Machine\: b44a6bba-a3e0-431b-825f-d52aa0ed88a8.d6b4be91-087a-437d-ba55-77fe32da747f.description=Changes a VM's power state. Must specify either hostSystem, clusterName, or vmResourcePool as a target location for VMs. Input Parameters\: vmName - name of the VM that will be created with this flow templateName - name of the VM template to clone in vCenter osType - linux or windows host - vCenter host to execute against user - vCenter username password - vCenter password vmDatacenter - target Datacenter on the vCenter host for the VMs dataStore - target datastore on the vCenter host for the VMs hostSystem - target ESX host for the VMs clusterName - target cluster for the VMs vmResourcePool - target resource pool for the VMs vmPowerState - the desired power state (on / off etc) Responses\: success - if the command completes execution and its exit code is 0 failure - otherwise Result Fields\: serviceXml - xml representation of the server created in vCenter b44a6bba-a3e0-431b-825f-d52aa0ed88a8.da96bf24-ba74-435e-a127-373f20a4e351.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
b44a6bba-a3e0-431b-825f-d52aa0ed88a8.description=
Restart the Virtual Machine

Inputs Parameters\:

 CSA_CONTEXT_ID – CSA Context Id
 CSA_PROCESS_ID – CSA Process Instance Id
 SVC_COMPONENT_ID - This token will resolve to the Service component Id. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\:SVC_COMPONENT_ID]
 RSC_PROVIDER_ID - This token will resolve to the Resource Provider Id that was selected at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\:RSC_PROVIDER_ID]
 SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_EMAIL - This token will resolve to the subscriber’s email address. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_EMAIL]
 RSC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID - This token will resolve to the Resource Subscription Id that was created from the Resource Offering at the Subscription time.
  		Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: RSC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID]
 SVC_COMPONENT_TYPE - This token will resolve to the Service component type. Eg\: Server.. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_COMPONENT_TYPE]
 RSC_POOL_ID - This token will resolve to the Resource pool Id that was selected at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: RSC_POOL_ID]
 SVC_INSTANCE_ID - This token will resolve to the Service Instance Id. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_INSTANCE_ID]
 SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID - This token will resolve to the Subscription Id that was created at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID]
 PRN_COMPONENT_ID – This token will resolve to the parent Component’s Service Component Id. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: PRN_COMPONENT_ID]
 REQ_ORG_ID - This token will resolve to the Organization Id associated with the service request. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: REQ_ORG_ID]
 REQ_USER_ID - This token will resolve to the User Id associated with the service request. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: REQ_USER_ID]
 USR_ORG_ID - This token will resolve to the Organization Id associated with the subscriber. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: USR_ORG_ID]
 RSC_BINDING_ID - This token will resolve to the Resource Binding Id that was created at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: RSC_BINDING_ID]

Responses\:
 success - The operation completed successfully.
 failure - Something went wrong.
b44a6bba-a3e0-431b-825f-d52aa0ed88a8.e04c5da5-b242-4b98-a1ce-7e6f99708239.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State
flow.name: vCenter Restart Server
